title: Huckleberry Hound Meets Wee Willy/Cousin Tex/Yogi Bear's Big Break
description: Farmer Huckleberry Hound meets a foxy fox discovered prowling in Huck's hen house.

title: Lion-Hearted Huck/Judo Jack/Slumber Party Smarty
description: Huck goes to Africa to bag a lion, but the lion uses all sorts of modern devices to outwit Huck. Finally, the brainy lion is himself bested by a jeep motor.

title: Tricky Trapper/Kit Kat Kit/Pie-Pirates
description: Huckleberry Hound gets his man but wishes he hadn't when he is assigned to bring in Powerful Pierre, an enormous woodsman.

title: Sir Huckleberry Hound/Jinks' Mice Device/Big Bad Bully
description: Huck is a brave knight called on to rescue a fair maiden in distress. But a surly Black Night guards Hassle Castle where the damsel is held. After many ignominious failures Huck finally reaches the fair one to find she is not so fair after all. In fact, she is grotesque and Huck locks himself in the towe

title: Sheriff Huckleberry/Pistol Packin' Pirate/Foxy Hound-Dog
description: Huck goes out to bring in Dinky Dalton, the desperado. Dinky turns out to be a giant and Huck is able to capture his man only after some fast thinking. Huck is a brave knight called on to rescue a fair maiden in distress.

title: Rustler Hustler Huck/Scaredycat Dog/The Brave Little Brave
description: Truant Officer Huckleberry Hound has been assigned to bring in two spoiled brats who skipped school.

title: Freeway Patrol/Little Bird-Mouse/Tally Ho Ho Ho
description: Police Officer Huckleberry Hound, at the wheel of a squad car, is ordered to bring in a fleeing bank robber.

title: Cock-A Doodle Huck/Jiggers... It's Jinks!/High Fly Guy
description: Farmer Huckleberry Hound meets a foxy fox discovered prowling in Huck's hen house.

title: Two Corny Crows/The Ghost with the Most/Baffled Bear
description: Farmer Huckleberry Hound is losing rows on rows of his corn crop to Iggy and Ziggy, a pair of crafty black birds who manage to outwit Huck at every turn.

title: The Ace of Space/Big Brave Bear
Fireman Huck/Jinks Junior
description: Sir Huck is reluctant to ride forth in search of the fire-breathing dragon which has terrified the realm.

title: Dragon-Slayer Huck/The Stout Trout
description: Huckleberry Hound is assigned by his boss, the fire chief, to rescue a kitten chased up a tree by a lively dog.

title: Jinks the Butler/The Buzzin' Bear
description: A crafty wolf uses a younger wolf to distract Sheepherder Huck so he can attack the lambs.

title: Hookey Daze/Jinks' Flying Carpet
description: Huck Hound has one of his most trying experiences with the neighbor's dog the evening he wants to barbecue a juicy steak in his backyard.

title: Skeeter Trouble/The Runaway Bear
description: Huck Hound's Grandpappy Huck tells Huck about his days as an Indian fighter, and to hear Grandpappy tell it he won the West single-handed, until the real truth is told.

title: Puppet Pals/Be My Guest Pest
description: Huckleberry Hound, nature loving citizen that he is, builds a bird house atop a pole.

title: Sheep-Shape Sheepherder/Mark of the Mouse
description: A crafty wolf uses a younger wolf to distract Sheepherder Huck so he can attack the lambs. But Huck is not to be distracted. None of the wolf's other ruses, including the use of blasting powder, keep Huck from attending to his duties and the hound emerges triumphant.

title: Barbecue Hound/Duck in Luck
description: A ferocious watchdog bars Huck's way while he is trying to deliver a letter.

title: Hokum Smokum/Hypnotize Surprise
description: Huck Hound's Grandpappy Huck tells Huck about his days as an Indian fighter, and to hear Grandpappy tell it he won the West single-handed, until the real truth is told.

title: Bird House Blues/Prize Fight Fright
description: Huckleberry Hound, nature loving citizen that he is, builds a bird house atop a pole. To Huck's dismay, crows move in instead of gentle songbirds, and Huck has an exasperating time evicting them.

title: Postman Panic/Nice Mice/Brainy Bear
description: A ferocious watchdog bars Huck's way while he is trying to deliver a letter. Huck tries all sorts of tricks to get the mail through. When he finally does make the delivery, he discovers the letter should go next door. As he departs, the guardian canine phones his bulldog pal next door to alert him.

title: Ski Champ Chump/King-Size Surprise/Robin Hood Yogi
description: Huckleberry Hound and Powerful Pierre compete for the ski championship.

title: Lion Tamer Huck/Cat-Nap Cat/Daffy Daddy
description: Persistent Huckleberry Hound has read a book on lion taming and undaunted by the fact the lion has just sharpened his fangs on a large file and then eaten the file! Huck tries to enter the lion's cage with comically disastrous results.

title: Little Red Riding Huck/Mouse-Nappers/Scooter Looter
description: The old nursery story is given a decidedly new twist. Grandma calls the police and accuses Huck of false impersonation and of trying to spoil the whole story.

title: The Tough Little Termite/Boxing Buddy/Hide and Go Peek
description: Huckleberry Hound encounters a termite that eats not only the wood in Huck's house, furniture and station wagon, but even the metal airplane in which Huck is trying to escape.

title: Show Biz Bear/Hi Fido/Ten Pin Alley
Bear Face Bear/Sour Puss/Jolly Roger and Out
Rah Rah Bear/Bird Brained Cat/Nottingham and Yeggs
Bear for Punishment/Batty Bat/Huck the Giant Killer
Windup Bear/A Good Good Fairy/Pony Boy Huck
